channel.title: A few question about pre-set ip

item.title: A few question about pre-set ip
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

To setup your own server read this,

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

As I stated before, if you already have Java files then there is no reason to decompile the class files. Just edit the Java files. Search for ‘setserver’ or ‘serverip’ and change it to your NO-IP once you have setup your server.

Read full topic
item.source: A few question about pre-set ip

item.title: A few question about pre-set ip
item.dc:creator: @deathnote777 deathnote777
item.description:
@deathnote777 wrote:

  1. What do i need to do to my to my “giu.class” ?

world = 1;
try
{
Serverip = “0.0.0.0”;
signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));
initUI();
}
catch(Exception exception)
{
exception.printStackTrace();
}
}
Do i need to change anything on my server ip ?

  1. Do I need to change anything in “Client.class” ? If Yes, What do i need to change ? (BTW, client.class is too large for “DJ java decompiler to open” . )

  2. What my friend need to change so that they can play my server ?

Read full topic
item.source: A few question about pre-set ip
